intro: Willwebera, commonly known as the swamp cabbage, is a flowering plant native to the wetlands of eastern Australia. It belongs to the family Myrtaceae and is characterized by its erect, herbaceous stems and broad, waxy leaves. The plant produces small, white or pinkish flowers arranged in clusters, which bloom from late winter to early spring. Willwebera thrives in moist, swampy environments and is often found in areas with poor drainage. Its ecological importance lies in providing habitat and food for various native wildlife species.
